_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Support Activities for Water Transportation

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC (Stolthaven) is a for-hire public bulk liquid storage and transfer facility. The facility is adjacent to the Mississippi River at Mile Point 80.   The facility receives, stores, and transfers a wide variety of bulk liquid materials including food grade oils, fuels, solvents, and industrial chemicals.  Bulk products are stored in aboveground storage tanks surrounded by secondary containment diked sized to contain a complete failure of the largest tank and rainfall associated with the 25 year, 24 hour storm event within the containment area.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies 

Stolthaven New Orleans, LLC is committed to operating in a safe and compliant manner. 
Employees involved in operating the acrylonitrile handling facility are trained to identify and understand the hazards posed during the storage and transfer process.  Training includes the review of information pertaining to the hazards of acrylonitrile, process technology, process equipment, and emergency response procedures. The facility maintains written process safety information to enable employees involved in handling acrylonitrile to identify and understand the hazards posed by these processes.  Written training information includes the physical properties of acrylonitrile, the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.  Process safety and emergency response materials are kept on site and periodically reviewed.

Regulated Substances Handled 

Stolthaven handles more than the threshold quantities of acrylonitrile (20,000 pounds). Stolthaven is regulated under the Program 2 requirements of 68.10.

Accidental Release Prevention Program  

Stolthaven??A?s accidental release prevention program includes all the elements required under Part 68 Subpart C including, Safety Information 68.48; Hazard Review 68.50; Operating Procedures 68.52; Training 68.54; Maintena

nce 68.56; Compliance Audits 68.58; and Incident Investigation 68.60.  Employees are provided with written training information which includes the physical properties of acrylonitrile, the health risks associated with chemical exposures, and material safety data sheets.

The five-year accident history 

The facility has never had an accident involving the covered chemicals that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

Stolthaven has a Facility Response Plan and SPCC Plan which outlines the coordination with local agencies in the event of spill or release.  

The Stolthaven facility was inspected by LDEQ in December 2009 and February 2010.  In February 2010, EPA preformed an RMP inspection.

Planned changes to improve safety 

Planned changes include continuous Safety Training for employees.
